system.description:
Melee covers hand-to-hand combat with fists, knives, or other melee weapons. It includes both attacking and defending against close-quarters assaults.

You make a Melee test when engaging an opponent in close combat or when trying to defend against a melee attack. If multiple people are fighting the same opponent, you may transfer your successes to others, improving their chances of success.

Extra Successes Can Be Used To:

  • Increase Damage – Inflict additional harm on your target.
  • Disarm – Knock a weapon or item from your opponent’s grasp.
  • Grapple – Engage in a hold or wrestle to restrain the target.
  • Trip – Knock the opponent off balance, causing them to fall.
  • Push Back – Force the opponent to move back or away from you.
  • Feint – Deceive the opponent, opening them up for a future attack.
